column7: Direct experience in the study of educational problems of concern to administrators; features an action component whereby the student is provided with opportunities for assuming responsibility for decision making in a live or simulated setting; each student works under the supervision of a professor, and where possible and appropriate, a practicing administrator. Same as EOL 560. 0 to 12 graduate hours. No professional credit. Approved for Letter and S/U grading. May be repeated to a maximum of 12 hours; no more than 4 hours earned at the master's level. Prerequisite: Students must be admitted to the General Administrative or Superintendent Endorsement program and must have completed at least 16 hours of EAL required courses, or consent of instructor.
